column2: The Anglian Invasion

Longboats full of Anglian settlers are grounding every month on the eastern shores of Britain. The newcomers are hungry and fierce warriors with their wives and children, and they are looking for new lands to call 'home'.\n\nThe Anglian warlords have no choice but to expand their realms to the west, and they are assembling their armies for war. Local British rulers should strengthen their defenses and be ready to fight for their lands.
Excellent! We shall rule over these lands!
They are dangerous foes...
This is interesting news...
The Anglian Invasion

Thousands of Germanic settlers keep landing every month on the beaches of the Anglo-Saxon Shore. Anglian rulers will soon raise their armies and march to war once more, determined to conquer new lands for the newcomers and their families.\n\nAnglian scouts have been spotted riding near the town of Latimer and the province of Sleaford. The local British rulers should strengthen their defenses and be ready to fight for their lands.
The Britons will run and hide in their holes!
They are growing too powerful...
This is interesting news...
The Anglian Invasion

Thousands of Germanic settlers keep landing every month on the beaches of the Anglo-Saxon Shore. Anglian rulers will soon raise their armies and march to war once more, determined to conquer new lands for the newcomers and their families.\n\nAnglian scouts have been spotted riding west into the Chiltern Hills north of the Thames and by the town of Vernemetum near Ratae. The local British rulers should strengthen their defenses and be ready to fight for their lands.
The Britons will run and hide in their holes!
They are growing too powerful...
This is interesting news...
The Anglian Invasion

Along the eastern shores of Britain hundreds of ships are landing. They are full of Germanic settlers fleeing from their burnt and sacked homelands on the continent. These warriors need food, they need land, they are desperate and dangerous. And they are many.\n\nThe Anglian rulers are calling every warrior to arms, and they will soon march west once more, looking for new lands to conquer.
We will destroy our enemies!
They must be stopped!
This is interesting news...
The Anglian Invasion

Longboats full of Anglian settlers keep landing on the eastern shores of Britain. The newcomers are hungry and fierce warriors with their wives and children, and they are looking for new lands to call 'home'.\n\nThe Anglian rulers have no choice but to expand their realms to the west, and they are assembling their armies for war.
Excellent! We will rule over these lands!
We must find a way to stop them!
Interesting news...
The Anglian Invasion

Thousands of Germanic settlers keep landing on the beaches of the Anglo-Saxon Shore. Anglian rulers will soon raise their armies and march to war once more to conquer new lands for their people.\n\nAnglian scouts have been spotted riding deep into the heart of Britain, towards the city of Lactodorum...
Excellent! We will rule over these lands!
We must find a way to stop them!
This is interesting news...
The Anglian Invasion

Another wave of Germanic settlers has landed on the eastern shores of Britain, full of hungry and fierce warriors desperate for new lands to conquer and settle.\n\nScouts and forward groups have been spotted riding and raiding past the Anglian border, as their armies assemble for war yet again.
Excellent! We will rule over these lands!
We must find a way to stop them!
This is interesting news...
The North Angles

Hundreds of longboats full of Germanic settlers are grounding on the northern shores of Britain, not far from the castle of Din Calaigh, in the province of Bryneich. The British kingdoms of the Old North must prepare to defend their lands from these Anglian invaders from across the sea, who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves north of Hadrian's Wall...
We will conquer the North!
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
They are a serious threat...
This is troubling news...
Where are they? This is MY land!
The North Angles

Another wave of longboats full of Germanic settlers approaches the northern shores of Britain. They are expected to land near the fortified town of Pons Aelii, in the province of Old Tyne. The British kingdoms of the Old North must prepare to defend their lands once more from these Anglian invaders from across the sea, who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves north of Hadrian's Wall...
The Saxon Invasion

Longboats full of Germanic settlers keep grounding on the shores of South Seaxe. The newcomers are hungry and fierce warriors with their wives and children, and they are looking for new lands to call 'home'.\n\nThe lords of Dumnonia will soon have to defend their lands from warbands of Saxon invaders determined to conquer and occupy the rich and fertile provinces of southern Britain, in particular the coastal provinces closest to South Seaxe, an area the Anglo-Saxons call "Meonware".
We will conquer these lands!
No, it is not the right time for an invasion.
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
This is troubling news...
They are a serious threat...

A small fleet of Jutish settlers has arrived in your capital of [Root.Capital.GetName]. Their leader, Port, has asked you for permission to settle his tribesmen in the newly conquered lands of Meonware, promising to swear fealty to your kingdom and help cement your rule over the Romano-British provinces.
More settlers are always welcome.
We do not need any pesky Jutes.
The West Saxons

Hundreds of longboats full of Germanic settlers are landing on the southern shores of Britain in the kingdom of Dumnonia. The British kingdoms of the south must now prepare to defend their lands from these Saxon invaders from across the sea, who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves in the rich lands they call "West Seaxe".

Germanic settlers pushing out from the Anglo-Saxon settlements on the Thames Valley are pushing south into lands ruled over by the kingdom of Dumnonia. The British kingdoms of the south must now prepare to defend their lands from these new Saxon tribes pushing out from the already settled lands who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves in the rich lands they call "West Seaxe".
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
They are a serious threat...
This is troubling news...
Saxons in [Root.GetName]

The invading armies of the West Saxons have conquered the province of [Root.GetName], and more and more Germanic settlers arrive by the day.\n\nThe local Britons have abandoned their homes and fled the region, leaving the Anglo-Saxons in full control of the province.
This is interesting news...
The West Saxons

Another wave of Germanic settlers is approaching the southern shores of Britain in the kingdom of Dumnonia. The British kingdoms of the south must now prepare once more to defend their lands from these Saxon invaders from across the sea, who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves in the rich lands they call "West Seaxe".

Another wave of Germanic settlers is pushing south from the Anglo-Saxon settlements on the Thames Valley into lands ruled over by the kingdom of Dumnonia. The British kingdoms of the south must now prepare once more to defend their lands from these new Saxon tribes pushing out from the already settled lands who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves in the rich lands they call "West Seaxe".
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
They are a serious threat...
This is troubling news...
Ultimatum to the Britons

[Root.Capital.GetName] has been an Anglo-Saxon settlement for many years now, but it remains under the overlordship of the Briton kingdom of [foederati_suzerain.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. However, our strength has been growing as more and more families arrive from the continent, while the Britons struggle to hold back the tide. Perhaps it is time that we establish our own kingdom here?
It is time for the Angles to rule in Lindsey!
No, it would be too risky.
Ultimatum from the Angles

The Angles settled in [From.Capital.GetName] have sent us an ultimatum, demanding control over the city of Lindum and all of Linnius as a whole. Should we not accept, they have also reminded us that they have many more warriors ready to fight than we do...
We have no choice but to submit.
We will not give up what is rightfully ours!.
Rise of Lindesege

Recognizing our military superiority, [From.GetTitledName] has accepted our ultimatum and ceded control of the realm over to us. We are now in a position to declare independence and establish our own kingdom of Lindesege, independent from our former British masters.

The traitorious Angle foederati settled in [Root.Capital.GetName] have deposed you and declared the creation the Kingdom of Lindesege over your old realm of Linnius. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and have let the Brythonic citizens know that the Angles are the masters now.

The Angles settled in [Root.Capital.GetName] have deposed the High Lord of Linnius and declared the creation the Kingdom of Lindesege in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom, having rapidly consolidated their control over the area, refuses to swear fealty to us and could become a real threat in the future...

The Angles settled in [Root.Capital.GetName] have deposed the High Lord of Linnius and declared the creation the Kingdom of Lindesege in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and as more settlers from the continent migrate to reinforce and strengthen the kingdom, further oppurtunities for Anglo-Saxon expansion into the weakening British realms of the Midlands are opening up.

The Angles settled in [Root.Capital.GetName] have deposed the High Lord of Linnius and declared the creation the Kingdom of Lindesege in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and now has the potential to pose a threat to the neighbouring British realms of Elmet and Ebrauc made newly vulnerable. Meanwhile, other British kingdoms worry about the loyalty of their own foederati - will they be next?
Excellent. Let the rule of the Angles commence!
We will have our revenge...
Cursed barbarians!
Another Angle kingdom rises!
This is extremely concerning...
Ultimatum Refused
[From.GetTitledName] has refused to accept our ultimatum and has even demanded that we submit and surrender immediately!
We will show the Wælisc who is powerful here!
Very well then. We have no choice.
Anglian Foederati Revolt

Unwilling to let us take over peacefully, the Britons have unwisely decided to resist our takeover of Linnius, forcing us to take up arms to take what is ours. Once we have defeated the Britons on the field of battle, we will be in a position to assert our dominance over these lands and establish an Angle kingdom of Lindesege here on the coast of the Midlands, independent of British rule or overlordship.

The foederati Angles have refused to submit and have instead declared war against us, intending to intending to take what they want by force. Their forces are rapidly mobilizing, and it seems that we have a fully fledged foederati revolt on our hands - one that will determine the fate of Linnius...

Our vassal, [From.GetTitledName], has informed us that the Angles of [From.Capital.GetName] have sent an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm. The ultimatum was dismissed, but the Angles have now mobilized against us, and they have now staged a fully fledged foederati revolt, intending to take control over the entirety of Linnius...

The foederati Angles settled in [From.Capital.GetName] have revolted against the High Lord of Linnius, after an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm was refused. War has broken out between the Britons and Angles in Linnius, as the foederati rebel against their masters to establish dominance over the realm. \n\nShould the revolt succeed, this will significantly compromise the British position in the upper Midlands, possibly presenting a possibility for other Anglo-Saxon groups to take advantage...

The foederati Angles settled in [From.Capital.GetName] have revolted against the High Lord of Linnius, after an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm was refused. War has broken out between the Britons and Angles in Linnius, as the foederati rebel against their masters to establish dominance over the realm. \n\nShould the revolt succeed, the fall of Linnius will present a significant setback for the Britons as Elmet and Ebrauc become exposed to Angle raids and invasions, and other British kingdoms are already looking nervously at their own foederati...
We shall be victorious!
To war! We will defend our lands from the barbarians!
The barbarians will not take our lands!
The weakling Wælisc will fall easily...
Vile barbarians!
Will we be next?
Angles Back Down
The Angles have backed down on their ultimatum and submitted to your rule. [From.GetTitledName] has surrendered and is now imprisoned in your dungeon, at your mercy.
A wise choice...
Rise of Lindesege
The Britons have been defeated and we now rule over Lindum, or Lincylene, as the town is now called. With Anglo-Saxons now in control of the area, we are now in a position to create our own kingdom.
The rule of the Angles begins today!
Revolt Defeated
The Britons have proven to be stronger than we expected and we have been forced to submit to them once more. Now that the Britons are back in control, we are completely at their mercy...
This will only be a temporary setback...
Revolt Stalemate

The Britons have proven to be stronger than we expected, but they have failed to defeat us on the battlefield either. We have been unable to take control over the region as we wished, but at least now we are no longer under the yoke of the Britons.
One day we will succeed...
The Iclingas

The Anglo-Saxon tribes are on the move. Not satisfied with the lands already conquered in Lloeygr, Germanic settlers are pushing out from the existing Anglo-Saxon kingdoms of the east. The British kingdoms of central Britain must now prepare to defend their lands from the tribe of the Iclingas pushing deep into the heart of Britain, seeking to conquer new lands for themselves in the lands they call "Mercia".
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
They are a serious threat...
This is troubling news...
Angles in [Root.GetName]

The invading armies of the Iclingas have conquered the province of [Root.GetName], and more and more Germanic settlers arrive by the day.\n\nThe local Britons have abandoned their homes and fled the region, leaving the Anglo-Saxons in full control of the province.
This is interesting news...
The Iclingas

The Anglo-Saxon tribes are on the move once more. Not satisfied with the lands already conquered in Lloeygr, Germanic settlers are pushing out from the existing Anglo-Saxon kingdoms of the east. The British kingdoms of central Britain must now prepare to defend their lands once more from the tribe of the Iclingas pushing deep into the heart of Britain, seeking to conquer new lands for themselves in the lands they call "Mercia".
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
They are a serious threat...
This is troubling news...
The Hwiccas

Yet another tribe has emerged as the Anglo-Saxons continue to push west. Anglo-Saxon settlers under the tribe of the Hwiccas are pushing out into the lands of the Dobunni tribe, towards the Severn Sea and the highly Romanized cities of the region. The British kingdoms of the area must now prepare to defend their lands from this new tribe pushing deep into the west, seeking to conquer new lands for themselves in the lands they call "Hwicce".
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
They are a serious threat...
This is troubling news...
Angles in [Root.GetName]

The invading armies of the Hwiccas have conquered the province of [Root.GetName], and more and more Germanic settlers arrive by the day.\n\nThe local Christian Britons are slowly assimilating into the culture of their new overlords, leaving the Anglo-Saxons in full control of the province, but not before converting them to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.

The invading armies of the Hwiccas have conquered the province of [Root.GetName], and more and more Germanic settlers arrive by the day.\n\nThe local Britons have abandoned their homes and fled the region, leaving the Anglo-Saxons in full control of the province.
This is interesting news...
The Hwiccas

As the Anglo-Saxon invaders continue to push west, Germanic settlers under the tribe of the Hwiccas are once more pushing out into the lands of the Dobunni tribe, towards the Severn Sea and the highly Romanized cities of the region. The British kingdoms of the area must now prepare to defend their lands once more from this new tribe pushing deep into the west, seeking to conquer new lands for themselves in the lands they call "Hwicce".
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
They are a serious threat...
This is troubling news...
Revolt for Independence

Our proud clan is currently but a minor realm, a vassal of [Root.Liege.GetTitledName]. If we are to aspire to the greatness of our ancestors, we must cast off the rule of other tribes and found our own independent kingdom on this land!
We are beholden to no one!
Rise of the Iclingas

A new clan is rising to prominence in the Midlands of Britannia. The Iclingas, descendants of the Scyldings that once ruled the old Angle kingdom, are quickly rising to power, casting off their lieges and making gains in the region.\n\nBritons and Saxons alike in the heart of Britannia should be wary of this new kingdom, as the Iclingas prepare to conquer all of the borderland marches in the Midlands - a land they call Mercia...
We will forge a great kingdom in Britannia!
We should be wary of these upstarts...
Our rule over the isles grows stronger day by day!
These barbarians must be stopped!
This is interesting news...
Revolt for Independence

Our first revolt has succeeded, but we are still under the control of [Root.Liege.GetTitledName]. If we are to aspire to the greatness of our ancestors, we must cast off the rule of other tribes and be the masters of our own fates!
We will be beholden to no one!
Failed Revolt

Our attempt to gain our independence has failed, and with it our current aspirations for hegemony in the region. However, the great clan of the Scyldings will not defeated and held subjugated so easily...
We are down, but not out!
Rise of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]

The borderlands between the Britons and Saxons have long been divided between many small states, squabbling with each other and posing little threat to the kingdoms elsewhere. However, [Root.GetTitledName] has claimed the region for himself, has now embarked on a campaign to conquer and unify the many kingdoms here.\n\nBritons and Saxons alike in the heart of Britannia should be wary of this new rising kingdom, as they prepare to conquer all of the borderland marches in the Midlands - a land they call Mercia...
We will forge a great kingdom in the Midlands!
We should be wary of these upstarts...
Our rule over the isles grows stronger day by day!
These barbarians must be stopped!
This is interesting news...
Ultimatum to the Britons

[Root.Capital.GetName] has been a Jutish settlement for many years now, but it remains under the overlordship of the Briton kingdom of [foederati_suzerain.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. However, our strength has been growing as more and more families arrive from the continent, while the Britons struggle to hold back the tide. Perhaps it is time that we establish our own kingdom here?
It is time for the Jutes to rule in Cantia
No, it would be too risky.
Ultimatum from the Jutes

The Jutes settled in [From.Capital.GetName] have sent us an ultimatum, demanding control over the city of Durovernum and all of Cantuaria as a whole. Should we not accept, they have also reminded us that they have many more warriors ready to fight than we do...
We have no choice but to submit.
We will not give up what is rightfully ours!.
Rise of Cantwaras

Recognizing our military superiority, [From.GetTitledName] has accepted our ultimatum and ceded control of the realm over to us. We are now in a position to declare independence and establish our own kingdom of Cantwaras, independent from our former British masters. [Root.GetRandomGodName] willing, a new era has begun in Britannia, where servant rules over master, Saxon over Briton...

The traitorious Jutish foederati settled in [Root.Capital.GetName] have deposed you and declared the creation the Kingdom of Cantwaras over your old realm of Cantuaria. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and have let the Romano-British citizens know that the Jutes are the masters now.

The Jutes settled in [Root.Capital.GetName] have deposed the King of Cantuaria and declared the creation the Kingdom of Cantwaras in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom, having rapidly consolidated their control over the area, refuses to swear fealty to us and could become a real threat in the future...

The Jutes settled in [Root.Capital.GetName] have deposed the King of Cantuaria and declared the creation the Kingdom of Cantwaras in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and as more settlers from the continent migrate to reinforce and strengthen the kingdom, a new power has been established in Britannia. With the rise of the Jutes in the southeast, it is only a matter of time before other Anglo-Saxons begin to take he oppurtunity to rise up and carve out new realms for themselves...

The Jutes settled in [Root.Capital.GetName] have deposed the King of Cantuaria and declared the creation the Kingdom of Cantwaras in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and now has the potential to pose a significant threat to the other Romano-British kingdoms in the southeast. Other British kingdoms watch in horror at the rapid fall of Cantuaria and worry about the loyalty of their own foederati - will they be next?
Excellent. Let the rule of the Jutes commence!
We will have our revenge...
Cursed barbarians!
Another Angle kingdom rises!
This is extremely concerning...
Deposition of Cantuaria

The Jutes settled in [From.Capital.GetName] have deposed the King of Cantuaria and declared the creation the Kingdom of Cantia in its place. The new Jutish kingdom refuses to swear fealty to us and could become a real threat in the future...
Cursed barbarians!
Ultimatum Refused
[From.GetTitledName] has refused to accept our ultimatum and has even demanded that we submit and surrender immediately!
We will show the Wælisc who is powerful here!
Very well then. We have no choice.
Jutish Foederati Revolt

Unwilling to let us take over peacefully, the Britons have unwisely decided to resist our takeover of Cantuaria, forcing us to take up arms to take what is ours. Once we have defeated the Britons on the field of battle, we will be in a position to assert our dominance over these lands and establish an Angle kingdom of Cantwaras here on the coast of southern Britannia, independent of British rule or overlordship. Perhaps this will be the beginning of the end for the Britons...

The foederati Jutes have refused to submit and have instead declared war against us, intending to intending to take what they want by force. Their forces are rapidly mobilizing, and it seems that we have a fully fledged foederati revolt on our hands - one that will determine the fate of Cantuaria, and perhaps much of Lloegyr as a whole...

Our vassal, [From.GetTitledName], has informed us that the Jutes of Ynys Tanatus have sent an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm. The ultimatum was dismissed, but the Angles have now mobilized against us, and they have now staged a fully fledged foederati revolt, intending to take control over the entirety of Cantuaria...

The foederati Jutes settled in Ynys Tanatus have revolted against the King of Cantuaria, after an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm was refused. War has broken out between the Britons and Angles in Ebrauc, as the foederati rebel against their masters to establish dominance over the realm. \n\nShould the revolt succeed, this will be a major coup for the Anglo-Saxons, bringing the Jutes to power for the first time and opening up southeast Britannia to increased settlement and invasion. Regardless of the outcome, this revolt will pave the way for the rise of other Anglo-Saxon kingdoms...

The foederati Jutes settled in Ynys Tanatus have revolted against the King of Cantuaria, after an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm was refused. War has broken out between the Britons and Angles in Cantuaria, as the foederati rebel against their masters to establish dominance over the realm. \n\nShould the revolt succeed, the fall of Cantuaria will be a significant blow for the Romano-Britons, leaving the kingdoms of the southeast and the city of Londinium vulnerable to invasion. And this may not be the last revolt...
We shall be victorious!
To war! We will defend our lands from the barbarians!
The barbarians will not take our lands!
The weakling Wælisc will fall easily...
Vile barbarians!
Will we be next?
Jutes Revolt
The Jutes have refused to submit and declared war, intending to take what they want by force!
To war! We will defend our lands from the barbarians!
Jutes Back Down
The Jutes have backed down on their ultimatum and submitted to your rule. [From.GetTitledName] has surrendered and is now imprisoned in your dungeon, at your mercy.
A wise choice...
Rise of Cantia
The Britons have been defeated and we now rule over Durovernum, or Cantwareburh, as the town is now called. With Jutes now in control of the area, we are now in a position to create our own kingdom.
The rule of the Jutes begins today!
A Brewing Storm

Cerdic's conquests brought the Kingdom of the South Saxons to glory and power, but the Jutes of Cantware and the other subjugated tribes have never quite fully accepted our rule. With the end of Cerdic's reign, the other tribes are becoming restless and agitating against our rule while we struggle to hold the kingdom together. It is only a matter of time before the first revolts...
Let them come and try...
We will face instability in our realm and revolts from our vassals until §Y20 years§! have passed or we have lost all of our outlying vassals outside of Sussex proper.

We have managed to persevere through the storms and revolts of the last several years with our realm at least partially intact. It seems that the rebellious tribes have now exhausted themselves and have acquiesed to the reality of South Saxon rule, at least for the time being.
Excellent.

The Jutes of Cantware and the Saxons of the West reign free once more, and the dream of South Saxon dominance over Ænglaland is more distant than ever. The loss of these restive regions, however, has allowed us to consolidate and restablish our rule over South Seaxe to end this period of strife in our realm.
One day, we will rise again...
The Death of Aelle

King Aelle of Anglia has taken his last breath, and thus his rule over Anglia has ended. His claim to the title of Bretwalda held together the diverse tribes of Angles and Saxons in their struggle to carve out a homeland - now his death heralds a bleaker period and more divided period for the Saxon peoples. Across his former lands his vassals now reject the new king, preferring to look in amongst themselves for strength. Though these rebellious types seek to be kings in their own right, it is possible still that his heir will earn his rule once more through strength and cunning, bringing the rebellious sorts to their knees.
Anglia must remain strong, in honour of the great king!
Perhaps this is our chance for power and independence...
A great king and warrior has died...
Perhaps this will stop the barbarians' advance...
This is interesting news...
The Deposition of Aelle

Aelle of Anglia has been cast from his throne, and thus his rule of Anglia has ended. His claim to the title of Bretwalda having made him the greatest King of the Saxon Shore, he now lives destitute, his legacy the mockery of those who have taken his crown. His fall has opened up divisions amongst the Saxons, and now his former vassals squabble amongst one another, unable to agree the legitimacy of the new King. Now looking in amongst themselves for strength, new rebels in Anglia are ignoring the rule of law that Aelle had upheld, though it is possible that his successor will earn his rule once more through strength and cunning, bringing the rebellious sorts to their knees.
A new era begins in Anglia!
Perhaps this is our chance for power and independence...
A great king is no more.
Perhaps this infighting will stop the barbarians' advance...
This is interesting news...

Under Aelle, Anglia was a strong and unified kingdom, but now the kingdom is fraught with division. Vassals are scheming left and right and some have even directly questioned your rights to the Kingdom of Anglia. It is only a matter of time before present a direct challenge to your power.
We must stop this before it gets out control!

Unlike his predecessor Aelle, [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] has failed to gain the confidence of the vassals he rules over, and many are beginning to question his authority over the Kingdom of Anglia. Many of them have banded together to declare their independence, not recognizing him as their true overlord, and have invited you to join them.
This is an excellent opportunity for independence.
[Root.Liege.GetFirstName] is the rightful king of Anglia and our rightful overlord.
A large number of disaffected Anglian warriors have gathered in [Root.Capital.GetName], promising to help you in your fight for independence against the King of Anglia.
Excellent.
Fall of Anglia

Once a great Anglo-Saxon kingdom and one of the most powerful realms in Britannia, the Kingdom of Anglia has fallen to internal infighting. Unable to keep the kingdom together, King [Root.GetFirstName] has been defeated by his vassals and forced to abdicate from the throne, dissolving the kingdom.\n\nWithout a unifying realm ruling over them all, the different groups within the former kingdom have begun to form new national identities. The East Saxons to the south are establishing their own identity independent of Anglia while the Angles settled in the west are beginning to consider themselves "Mercians", and only the East Angles still consider themselves part of Anglia.
We will remember their treachery...
The Anglian domination has ended! It is time for us to rule!
Hah! Let the barbarians fight among themselves!
This is interesting news...

With no side gaining a clear advantage, you have agreed to a white peace and a truce with your vassals. While you have held your kingdom together for now, you have still not gained the respect of your vassals, and soon they could rise up once more...
We will must stay strong and vigilant against the traitors!

With neither side being truly defeated, we have agreed to a white peace and a truce with [Root.Liege.GetTitledName]. While Anglia remains under his yoke, he has not gained the confidence of his vassals, who are still scheming to gain their independence as soon as their truce ends.
Next time we will succeed...

Having decisively crushed your rebellious vassals on the battlefield, they have been forced to bend to your rule once more, and those who did not revolt have been quick to reaffirm their allegiance. You are now recognized as the undisputed King of Anglia, and those that opposed you are now completely at your mercy.

We have bought some respite with our decisive victories, but there is still much resentment about our overlordship among our vassals. While some are beginning to recognize our right to all of Anglia it will take more work before we are truly recognized as the proper heirs of Aelle.
Excellent. Let that be an example to any else plotting against me...
And we will prevail!

Your forces have been crushed and you have been forced to kneel to [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] once more. With your bid for independence crushed, you have been forced to recognized as [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] your rightful overlord, and you are now completely at his mercy...

Despite overwhelming support from the vassal tribes we have been defeated by the armies of [Root.Liege.GetTitledName]. While many of [Root.GetHerHis] vassal chiefs and tribes remain restless some are coming around to [Root.GetHerHis] claim as the rightful king of all Anglia, and it may be that one more decisive battle will confirm [Root.GetHerHis] rule for good.
One day, we will be successful...
We will not be defeated again!
Ultimatum to the Britons

[Root.Capital.GetName] has been an Anglo-Saxon settlement for many years now, but it remains under the overlordship of the Briton kingdom of [foederati_suzerain.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. However, as migration from the continent grows our strength we have been becoming increasingly dominant over the Britons here. We have now sent an ultimatum to [foederati_suzerain.GetTitledName], demanding that [foederati_suzerain.GetSheHe] cede control of the realm to us.
It is time for the Angles to rule in Beornice!
No, it would be too risky.
Ultimatum from the Angles

The Angles settled in [From.Capital.GetName] have sent us an ultimatum, demanding control over our entire kingdom of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Should we not acceed to their demands, they have also reminded us that they have many more warriors ready to fight than we do...
We have no choice but to submit.
We will not give up what is rightfully ours!.
Rise of Beornice

Recognizing our military superiority, [From.GetTitledName] has accepted our ultimatum and ceded control of the realm over to us. We are now in a position to declare independence and establish our own kingdom of Beornice, independent from our former British masters. [Root.GetRandomGodName] willing, we may soon be masters of all north of the Humber...

The traitorious Angle foederati settled in Bryneich have deposed you and declared the creation the Kingdom of Beornice over your old realm of Bryneich. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and have let the Cumbric citizens know that the Angles are the masters now.

The Angles settled in Bryneich have deposed the King of Bryneich and declared the creation the Kingdom of Beornice in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom, having rapidly consolidated their control over the area, refuses to swear fealty to us and could become a real threat in the future, as they may not be satisfied with just Bryneich...

The Angles settled in Bryneich have deposed the King of Bryneich and declared the creation the Kingdom of Beornice in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and as more settlers from the continent migrate to reinforce and strengthen the kingdom, the invulnerability of the Old North has been broken, paving the way for the rise of the Anglo-Saxons in the north...

The Angles settled in Bryneich have deposed the King of Bryneich and declared the creation the Kingdom of Beornice in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and now has the potential to pose a significant threat to all of the other kingdoms of Hen Ogledd. Other British kingdoms, especially the Kingdom of Ebrauc, worry about the loyalty of their own foederati - will they be next?
Excellent. Let the rule of the Angles commence!
We will have our revenge...
Cursed barbarians!
Another Angle kingdom rises!
This is extremely concerning...
Ultimatum Refused
[From.GetTitledName] has refused to accept our ultimatum and has even demanded that we submit and surrender immediately!
We will show the Wælisc who is powerful here!
Very well then. We have no choice.
Anglian Foederati Revolt

Unwilling to let us take over peacefully, the Cumbrians have unwisely decided to resist our takeover of Bryneich, forcing us to take up arms to take what is ours. Once we have defeated the Cumbrians on the field of battle, we will be in a position to assert our dominance over these lands and establish an Angle kingdom of Beornice here on the coast of northern Britannia, independent of British rule or overlordship. Perhaps this will be the start of something more, as the lands north of the Humber beckon...

The foederati Angles have refused to submit and have instead declared war against us, intending to intending to take what they want by force. Their forces are rapidly mobilizing, and it seems that we have a fully fledged foederati revolt on our hands - one that will determine the fate of Bryneich, and perhaps all of the Old North...

Our vassal, [From.GetTitledName], has informed us that the Angles of Bryneich have sent an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm. The ultimatum was dismissed, but the Angles have now mobilized against us, and they have now staged a fully fledged foederati revolt, intending to take control over the entirety of Bryneich...

The foederati Angles settled in Bryneich have revolted against the King of Bryneich, after an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm was refused. War has broken out between the Britons and Angles in Bryneich, as the foederati rebel against their masters to establish dominance over the realm. \n\nShould the revolt succeed, this will be a major blow to the Britons of the north, possibly presenting a possibility for other Anglo-Saxon groups to rise up and establish their own rule...

The foederati Angles settled in Bryneich have revolted against the King of Bryneich, after an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm was refused. War has broken out between the Britons and Angles in Bryneich, as the foederati rebel against their masters to establish dominance over the realm. \n\nThe fall of Bryneich would be a major blow for the Cumbrics of Hen Ogledd, exposing the northern flank of Britannia to Angle raids and invasions. Other British kingdoms - in particular the Kingdom of Ebrauc - are already watching their own foederati with concern...
We shall be victorious!
To war! We will defend our lands from the barbarians!
The barbarians will not take our lands!
The weakling Wælisc will fall easily...
Vile barbarians!
Will we be next?
To war! We will defend our lands from the barbarians!
Angles Back Down
The Angles have backed down on their ultimatum and submitted to your rule. [From.GetTitledName] has surrendered and is now imprisoned in your dungeon, at your mercy.
A wise choice...
Rise of Beornice
The Britons have been defeated and we now managed to gain control over much of the Bernician coast. With Anglo-Saxons now in control of the area, we are now in a position to create our own kingdom.
The rule of the Angles begins today!
Ultimatum to the Britons

[Root.Capital.GetName] has been an Anglo-Saxon settlement for many years now, but it remains under the overlordship of the Briton kingdom of [foederati_suzerain.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. However, as migration from the continent grows our strength we have been becoming increasingly dominant over the Britons here. We have now sent an ultimatum to [foederati_suzerain.GetTitledName], demanding that [foederati_suzerain.GetSheHe] cede control of the realm to us.
It is time for the Angles to rule in Derenice!
No, it would be too risky.
Ultimatum from the Angles

The Angles settled in [From.Capital.GetName] have sent us an ultimatum, demanding control over our entire kingdom of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Should we not acceed to their demands, they have also reminded us that they have many more warriors ready to fight than we do...
We have no choice but to submit.
We will not give up what is rightfully ours!.
Rise of Derenice

Recognizing our military superiority, [From.GetTitledName] has accepted our ultimatum and ceded control of the realm over to us. We are now in a position to declare independence and establish our own kingdom of Derenice, independent from our former British masters. [Root.GetRandomGodName] willing, we may soon be masters of all north of the Humber...

The traitorious Angle foederati settled in [Root.Capital.GetName] have deposed you and declared the creation the Kingdom of Derenice over your old realm of Ebrauc. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and have let the Cumbric citizens know that the Angles are the masters now.

The Angles settled in [Root.Capital.GetName] have deposed the King of Ebrauc and declared the creation the Kingdom of Derenice in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom, having rapidly consolidated their control over the area, refuses to swear fealty to us and could become a real threat in the future...

The Angles settled in [Root.Capital.GetName] have deposed the King of Ebrauc and declared the creation the Kingdom of Derenice in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and as more settlers from the continent migrate to reinforce and strengthen the kingdom, the Britons will find it increasingly difficult to resist the rise of the Anglo-Saxons in the north.

The Angles settled in [Root.Capital.GetName] have deposed the King of Ebrauc and declared the creation the Kingdom of Derenice in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and with the very heart of Hen Ogledd now under their control now has the potential to pose a significant threat to the remaining British kingdoms in the area.
Excellent. Let the rule of the Angles commence!
We will have our revenge...
Cursed barbarians!
Another Angle kingdom rises!
This is extremely concerning...
Ultimatum Refused
[From.GetTitledName] has refused to accept our ultimatum and has even demanded that we submit and surrender immediately!
We will show the Wælisc who is powerful here!
Very well then. We have no choice.
Anglian Foederati Revolt

Unwilling to let us take over peacefully, the Cumbrians have unwisely decided to resist our takeover of Ebrauc, forcing us to take up arms to take what is ours. Once we have defeated the Cumbrians on the field of battle, we will be in a position to assert our dominance over these lands and establish an Angle kingdom of Derenice here on the coast of northern Britannia, independent of British rule or overlordship. Perhaps this will be the start of something more, as the lands north of the Humber beckon...

The foederati Angles have refused to submit and have instead declared war against us, intending to intending to take what they want by force. Their forces are rapidly mobilizing, and it seems that we have a fully fledged foederati revolt on our hands - one that will determine the fate of Ebrauc, and perhaps all of the Old North...

Our vassal, [From.GetTitledName], has informed us that the Angles of [From.Capital.GetName] have sent an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm. The ultimatum was dismissed, but the Angles have now mobilized against us, and they have now staged a fully fledged foederati revolt, intending to take control over the entirety of Ebrauc...

The foederati Angles settled in [From.Capital.GetName] have revolted against the King of Ebrauc, after an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm was refused. War has broken out between the Britons and Angles in Ebrauc, as the foederati rebel against their masters to establish dominance over the realm. \n\nShould the revolt succeed, this will be a major victory for the Anglo-Saxons, bringing all of the eastern coast of Britannia under Saxon control and opening the way into the Pennines and the Forest of Elmet...

The foederati Angles settled in [From.Capital.GetName] have revolted against the King of Ebrauc, after an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm was refused. War has broken out between the Britons and Angles in Ebrauc, as the foederati rebel against their masters to establish dominance over the realm. \n\nShould the revolt succeed, the fall of Ebrauc will be a major blow for the Cumbrics of Hen Ogledd, leaving the city of Eburacum and the heart of Hen Ogledd under the control of the Saxons.
We shall be victorious!
To war! We will defend our lands from the barbarians!
The barbarians will not take our lands!
The weakling Wælisc will fall easily...
Vile barbarians!
Will we be next?
Angles Back Down
The Angles have backed down on their ultimatum and submitted to your rule. [From.GetTitledName] has surrendered and is now imprisoned in your dungeon, at your mercy.
A wise choice...
Rise of Derenice

The Britons have been defeated and we now managed to gain control over much of the former British kingdom of Deifr. With Anglo-Saxons now in control of the area, we are now in a position to create our own kingdom.
The rule of the Angles begins today!
The North Folc

Hundreds of longboats full of Germanic settlers are grounding on the northern shores of Britain, not far from the castle of Caer Went, in the province of Icenia. The British kingdoms of the east must prepare to defend their lands from these Anglian invaders from across the sea, who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves...
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
They are a serious threat...
This is troubling news...
Where are they? This is MY land!
Angles in Cnobheresburg

The invading armies of the East Angles have conquered the province of Cnobheresburg, and more ships full of Germanic settlers land every day.\n\nThe local Britons have abandoned their homes and fled the region, leaving the Anglo-Saxons in full control of the province.
This is interesting news...
The East Angles

Another wave of longboats full of Germanic settlers approaches the eastern shores of Britain. They are expected to land near the fortified town of Venta Icenorum, in the province of Went. The British kingdoms of the east must prepare to defend their lands once more from these Anglian invaders from across the sea, who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves...
The Great Dyke of [Root.GetFirstName]

The Anglo-Saxon rulers of central Britain have erected a massive earthwork along their western border, from the hills of Kenceaster in the south, to the crossing of the river Severn near Wroxeter in the north. The defensive structure is a statement of power, and will protect Anglo-Saxon lands from the native Britons still ruling in the deep valleys of Gwynedd and Powys.\n\nThis great barrier effectively seperates the Anglo-Saxon territories from the remaining British lands in the west, firmly dividing the island in two. With the loss of their heartlands, the Britons have now effectively ended the old elective system of Britannia, and now sturggle for dominance over the remaining lands that they call 'Cymru'.
Let the Wealas flee and hide into their mountains... little dogs!
This is most worrisome...
This is quite interesting news...

Reports have reached your court of a considerable excitement spreading amongst the now-subjugated Anglo-Saxon inhabitants of Britannia. While no one seems to be quite sure what exactly is the cause of all this, all agree that this has surprisingly made the Anglo-Saxons more peaceable and submissive.

Rumours are spreading like wildfire among the Anglo-Saxon people of Britannia. While it is spoken of in only the quietest of whispers, you have managed to gleam that [Root.GetDynName] is gathering a large warband back on the continent and seems to be organizing some sort of plot to free us from the British yoke.
Interesting. I'm sure it is nothing important though.
All Anglo-Saxon provinces get the §YAnglo-Saxons Pacified§! modifier.
Could [Root.GetSheHe] be the saviour we have been waiting for?
The Saxon Armada

An enormous fleet has landed on the coast of [anglo_saxon_return_invader_target_province.GetName], unloading a massive Germanic warhost the size of which has perhaps never been seen before.  They are under the command of [anglo_saxon_return_invader.GetDynName], who has apparently spent the last several years recruiting exiles and adventurers from the continent and has vowed to reconquer the kingdoms of [anglo_saxon_return_invader.GetHerHis] ancestors and claim the entirety of Britannia for the Anglo-Saxons.\n\nIn a seemingly coordinated action, bands of Saxons have risen up all over the island, creating widespread chaos and disrupting the Britons as they scramble to organize their defences. Does this second Adventus mark a new era of an Anglo-Saxon Aenglaland?
[This.Religion.GetHighGodName] shall grant us victory!
Let's see how this goes.
[Root.GetSheHeCap] actually did it...
No! This can't be happening again!
This is worrying news...
The Return of the Saxons

The Anglo-Saxon rebellion has been victorious! The Germanic armies overwhelmed the British defenders who were forced to completely abandon [Root.Capital.Kingdom.GetName], and in celebration of this victory [Root.GetDynName] has been acclaimed Bretwalda over all Aenglaland in the great hall of [Root.Capital.GetName].\n\nThe new Bretwalda has vowed not to rest until every last Anglo-Saxon province has been liberated from British rule, and has already been making aggressive overtures towards [Root.GetHerHis] neighbouring realms. As the Britons lick their wounds and watch the Bretwalda's still-massive warbands warily, many wonder if this will be the [Root.GetManWoman] to do what generations before [Root.GetHerHim] could not and destroy the power of the Britons once and for all.
The Age of the Saxons has returned!
Well, let them have their fun again I suppose.
We will not rest until they are defeated!
The §YCultural Reclamation§! casus belli is unlocked against all Germanic rulers holding territory in the region of §YBritannia§!.
This is worrying news...
The Defeat of the Saxons

The early victories of the Bretwalda gave them great hope, but ultimately it was not to be. The Britons rallied and exploited the divisions amongst them, and now the last of the revived Anglo-Saxon kingdoms have now been destroyed, their kings forced to flee back across the sea or bend the knee to their renewed British masters. The old dream of an Anglo-Saxon Aenglaland has now well and truly been crushed and buried, and those that still watch the Eastern Sea are content in the knowledge that nothing will ever be able to truly conquer Britannia.

The hopes of the Saxons were dashed against the coast of [anglo_saxon_return_invader_target_province.GetName], as the Britons rallied and defeated the great warhost in some of the largest battles that Britannia has seen in centuries. What warriors remained have fled back to Germania in humiliation or disappeared into the villages from where they came, fearing retribution from the vengeful British. The old dream of an Anglo-Saxon Aenglaland has now well and truly been crushed and buried, and those that still watch the Eastern Sea are content in the knowledge that the nothing will ever conquer Britannia.
May those barbarians never return. Ever.
And the British yoke returns...
Perhaps we should consider some softer targets...
How pathetic. We'll show them how it's done.
This is interesting news...
An Anglo-Saxon Catholic King

[Root.GetTitledName] is the first Anglo-Saxon Catholic king to ever rule in Britain. Many among his subjects are ready to follow his example and to abandon their old pagan faiths in favor of the new religion.
This is unacceptable! We must remain true to our ancient Gods!
Excellent! We will rule Britain in the name of God!
This is troubling news...
At last, the true light of God has touched those brutal boors.
Angles in Bryneich

The invading armies of the North Angles have conquered the province of Bryneich, and more ships full of Germanic settlers land every day.\n\nThe local Britons have abandoned their homes and fled the region, leaving the Anglo-Saxons in full control of the province.
This is interesting news...

The ancient Romano-British town of Corinium is now ruled and populated by Anglo-Saxons.\n\nA new language is spoken in the markets, new customs are being introduced, and from now on the settlement will be known as 'Cirenceaster'.
This is interesting news...

The ancient Briton town of Venta is now ruled and populated by Anglo-Saxons.\n\nA new language is spoken in the markets, new customs are being introduced, and from now on the settlement will be known as 'Winceaster'.
This is interesting news...

The ancient Romano-British town of Durnovaria is now ruled and populated by Anglo-Saxons.\n\nA new language is spoken in the markets, new customs are being introduced, and from now on the settlement will be known as 'Dorceaster'.
This is interesting news...

The ancient Romano-British town of Calleva is now ruled and populated by Anglo-Saxons.\n\nA new language is spoken in the markets, new customs are being introduced, and from now on the settlement will be known as 'Silceaster'.
This is interesting news...
The Kingdom of Strathclyde

The northern Celtic kingdom of Ystrad Clud is now ruled by an Anglo-Saxon king.\n\nA new language is spoken at court, new customs are being introduced, and from now on the realm will be known as 'Kingdom of Strathclyde'.
This is interesting news...
The Roman Fort of Magnis
The ancient Roman fort of Magnis has been sacked and burned to the ground by the Anglo-Saxon invaders who now rule the province.
The legacy of Rome is fading away...

column1: ### SAXON INVASION OF SALLAND AND HAMALAND ###

column2: Saxon Incursions

The Saxon tribes of northern Germania are on the move. Saxon settlers and warbands are pouring west from Westphalia, into the old Frankish lands of the Salii and Chamavi north of the Rhine. The remaining Frankish tribes of the area must now prepare to defend their lands from these new tribes pushing deep into the west, seeking to conquer new lands for themselves in the lands they call "Hamaland".
We will rule these lands!
They are a serious threat...
This is interesting news...
Saxons in [Root.GetName]

The invading armies of the Saxons have conquered the province of [Root.GetName], and more and more Saxon settlers arrive by the day.\n\nThe local Franks have by and large abandoned their homes and fled the region, leaving the Saxons in full control of the province.
This is interesting news...
Saxon Incursions

The Saxon tribes of northern Germania are on the move once more. Saxon settlers and warbands are again pouring west from Westphalia, into the old Frankish lands of the Salii and Chamavi north of the Rhine. The remaining Frankish tribes of the area must now once more prepare to defend their lands from these new tribes pushing deep into the west, seeking to conquer new lands for themselves in the lands they call "Hamaland".
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
They are a serious threat...
This is interesting news...
You have received word that your vassal [From.GetTitledName] has raised a large host from his lands and is about to embark on an adventure to carve out a new realm in Gaul.
Well... good luck with that!

You have received word that [From.GetTitledName] has raised a large army from his realm in Germania and is now sailing towards Gaul. [From.GetHerHis] warband of fierce Saxon warriors is coming to raid, pillage, and conquer...
We will defeat these barbarians!

You have declared your intentional to found a new realm in Gaul, and a large number of adventerous warriors eager to fight for the riches of that land from your realm and beyond have begun to gather at your court. In about two months, you should have gathered a large enough host to go on your adventure.
Land, plunder, and glory await!
You and your men begin your preparations for the invasion.

The preperations for your Gallic adventure are complete. Your newly raised fleet and army are now sitting in your harbour, full of eager, fierce warriors impatiently waiting for you to take them to war in Gaul for plunder, glory, and land.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] will grant us victory!

You may now use the §YDuchy Invasion§! casus belli against any one non-Germanic ruler in the region of §YNorthwestern Gaul§!, expiring in one month. Upon declaring the invasion, you will receive a number of event troops and an event fleet. Roman areas are an easier target to hold on to, as the hardy Armoricans will be significantly more difficult to subdue and assimilate.
Army Arrives
The great army you have raised for your Gallic adventure has arrived. Your enemies will surely tremble when they hear of the great warriors about to descend on their defenseless lands!
To Gaul we go!
Gallic Conquest

Leaving your old realm in Germania behind, you have won a great victory and conquered for yourself a new kingdom in Gaul. While the Franks, Visigoths, Armoricans, and any remaining Roman authorities may still pose a threat to your kingdom, you have let the people of Gaul know that the [From.Culture.GetName]s are here to rule and here to stay.
The rule of the [From.Culture.GetName]s begins today!
Invasion Abandoned
Having waited for a month for you to bring them to Gaul, the army you have raised for the invasion has largely dispersed, disillusioned and disappointed that you have broken your promises.
Fools...
Saxons in [Root.GetName]

The invading armies of the Saxons have conquered the province of [Root.GetName], and more and more Saxon settlers arrive by the day. They now form a majority in [Root.GetName] as the local Gallic populace is slowly outnumbered and pushed out of the region.
Excellent.
All titles outside of Northwestern Gaul are abdicated to your current heir.

Preparations for the migration across the sea have begun, as our people pack up their livestock and belongings and gather near the fleet of ships we have constructed for the migration. While some of our tribesmen have chosen to stay behind in our homeland, the majority of what remains of the Angle nation now prepares to cross the German Sea and make our new home in Britannia.
It is for the good of our people.
The Migration of the Angles

Struggling from the effects of past migrations and pressure from the ascendant Danes, the last of the Angles in their homeland on the continent have decided to leave their homeland forever to join their brethren in Britannia. Under the leadership of their king, [Root.GetTitledName], the Angle nation is now sailing across the German Sea, determined to find a new home in Britannia as the Danes take over their former kingdom.\n\nThe British kingdoms of the Midlands must now keep guard as the Angles seek land to settle on, and though the realm of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]s may for now remain small, the old prestige and ambition of their people means that it may not stay so...
Onwards to a new Anglia!
May they find a new home to settle in.
Excellent! Let our brethren join us in our new lands!
Let them go to their faraway lands...
Those barbarians must be stopped!
This is interesting news...
You abandon Angeln for new lands abroad.
Help for the Angles

You have received a request from [From.GetFirstName], the former King of the Angles now leading his people in Cnobheresburg, for aid in acquiring new terrritories to settle in. In return for helping them to conquer the British province of [angles_province.GetName] which they eye as their new home, [From.GetFirstName] has agreed to swear fealty to you.
Of course we will help our brothers in need!
No. They can fight for themselves.
Invasion of [angles_province.GetName]

We have landed at the port of Cnobheresburg, and our tribe and armies are now making our way towards the Briton kingdoms to the west, towards the province of [angles_province.GetName] that we have chosen as our target. In return for suzerainty over our kingdom, [From.GetTitledName] has given us aid and supplies to help us conquer [angles_province.GetName] and make it our new home.
Excellent! This land will soon be ours!
Invasion of [angles_province.GetName]

We have landed at the port of Cnobheresburg, and our tribe and armies are now making our way towards the Briton kingdoms to the west, towards the province of [angles_province.GetName] that we have chosen as our target. Despite our requests, [From.GetTitledName] has refused to help us in our conquest of the province - something they will pay for in the future...
We will conquer it anyway!
Invasion of [angles_province.GetName]

Having crossed the German Sea, we have chosen the Briton province of [angles_province.GetName] as our target, and our tribe and armies have landed and are quickly making their way to take control of the province. [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] willing, this will soon be our new home.
Our new kingdom begins here!
Conquest of [Root.Capital.GetName]

Our armies have triumphed over the Britons, and already our people are settling in [Root.Capital.GetName] mixing with and displacing the native Briton populace. Our people have successfully crossed the sea, and we have managed to establish our own kingdom here in this new land.
This will be our new realm and home.
It seems that our war of conquest for a province to call our new home has become invalid.
We'll just have to try again.
Angles Defeated

Our armies have been defeated by the Britons, and we have been unable to carve off the province we desired as our new realm and home. However, already our tribe is reorganizing and raising another army to fight - hopefully successfully this time...
We will not be defeated again!
Angles Defeated

We have been defeated by the Britons once more, and this time we do not have the manpower to try again. Now, we must try to settle our tribe on more friendly lands - hopefully one of the other Anglo-Saxon kingdoms will allow us to settle on their lands...
Our brothers will help us in our time of need...
Request for Settlement

[From.GetFirstName], the former King of the Angles now leading his people in Cnobheresburg, has come forward to you, requesting that you allow [From.GetHerHis] tribe to settle in your province of [angles_province.GetName]. [From.GetSheHe] has agreed to swear fealty to you in return, and [From.GetHerHis] tribe will quickly assimilate the current British majority there.
The province is yours to settle in.
No. This land is our land.
Settlement Granted

[From.GetTitledName] has graciously granted us the right to settle in their province of [angles_province.GetName]. Our tribesmen are now settling in the province, setting up homesteads and forts as our people mix with and displace the native British populace. Our people have successfully crossed the sea, and we have managed to establish our own kingdom here in this new land.
A new home and a new era for our people...
Failed Migration

Our attempts at conquest have failed, and none of our brethren are willing or able to give us land to settle our tribe in. Without any land to call home, our once-mighty nation has been forced to disperse, breaking up to try to find a home with whomever will take them, ending our dream of a new home in Britannia.
We will not be forgotten!

After years of immigration and natural growth, the population of [Root.GetName] is beginning to recover from the nearly desolate province it once was. Fallow fields are being cleared once more, abandoned settlements are seeing signs of inhabitation and the province seems to be gradually returning to normal.

After years of immigration and natural growth, the population of [Root.GetName] has recovered significantly from the depopulations and migrations of the past. Much of the land is beginning to be worked again, settlements are beginning to bustle and the province is returning to its full potential.

After years of immigration and natural growth, the population of [Root.GetName] has recovered from the depopulations and migrations of the past. The land has been largely reclaimed, thriving settlements now dot the province and the province has returned to its full potential.
Excellent. May [Root.GetName] prosper once more.

We have sent an emissary to the King of Bryneich, offering him our services as foederati in his kingdom. Should he accept, we will be allowed to settle in his coastal lands and paid in exchange for fighting on his behalf. Of course, this arrangement might not last forever...
I am sure we can come to a mutually beneficial arrangement.
Foederati Request

You have received an emissary from [From.GetTitledName] offering his services to you as foederati. His warbands and peoples would be of great use against the wretched Picts and Scots that have so ravaged our lands, though the tribulations of our cousins in Lloegyr serves as a stark warning of what could go wrong. Then again, the Saxons of the North have so far been quite docile and cooperative, so perhaps our foederati will not become an existential threat to us, and if we do not grant them land on our terms, they may take it from us on theirs...
We are in need of foederati.
There will be no Saxons in my kingdom.
Settlement Granted

Our emissary has returned, bringing the news that [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to grant us the province of [angle_target_province.GetName] to settle in in exchange for our service as foederati. Our people are now packing their belongings and making the journey to their new home in Beornice.
Excellent! Fame and fortune await!
Settlement Denied

Our emissary has returned with the news that [From.GetTitledName] has refused our offer of foederati status, clearly fearing the fate of the Britons to the south. We will have to remain here in Norþfolc for now, but in time, we may eventually be able to acquire land of our own - by force...
One way or another, the North will be ours...
Cynerice of Ænglaland

[From.GetTitledName] has proclaimed himself worthy of the title of Bretwalda of the Anglo-Saxons, but his legitimacy depends on the consensus of the other Kings. Will you support [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s claim to the throne and recognize him as rightful Bretwalda of Ænglaland?
[From.GetTitledFirstName] is a great leader. I will support his cause.
I will bow to no King. Not even this King.

Great [Root.GetTitledName], I have taken your claim into consideration and decided to grant you my full support and recognition as Bretwalda of Ænglaland. May your rule be a long and prosperous one.

Respectfully,
[From.GetTitledName]
Very good. You have made the right choice.

My [Root.GetTitle], I have taken your request into consideration, and I respectfully inform you that I will not support your claim to the Cynerice of Ænglaland.
You lack the strength and wisdom necessary to hold such a prestigious throne.

Please renounce all your claims,
[From.GetTitledName]
I understand... and I will renounce my claim. For now.
I am confident we will come to a mutually beneficial agreement...
I will prove you wrong on the battlefield! Prepare for war!

[Root.GetTitledFirstName] declares war on [From.GetTitledName].\nIf victorious, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will have another chance to claim the title of Bretwalda of Ænglaland. The support of [From.GetTitledFirstName] will no longer be needed.\nIf defeated, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will lose every right to the Cynerice, and will never be allowed to reclaim it.
Cynerice of Ænglaland

The kings of the Anglo-Saxons have declared their unanimous support to [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]'s claim to the Cynerice of Ænglaland.

The Bretwalda has been crowned in the Great Mead Hall of [From.Capital.GetName]. The other Anglo-Saxon kings have sworn fealty to him, and from now on they will rule their homelands as vassal kings of Ænglaland.

The Bretwalda will hold his title as long as he keeps proving his worth on the battlefield, as well as in the council halls.
Excellent! In the name of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodName], I am the Bretwalda.
Glory to [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
What pretentiousness is this?
This is interesting news...
Death of the Bretwalda

[Root.GetTitledName], Bretwalda of the Anglo-Saxons, has died. The title of Bretwalda lies vacant once more, as only a king who has proven himself as a worthy overlord of the Anglo-Saxons could hope to claim such authority over all of Ænglaland.\n\nWith the Bretwalda dead, [Root.GetHerHis] various vassals and subject kingdoms watch [Root.GetHerHis] now-succeeded heir closely for signs of strength or weakness, weighing whether to support the new [bretwalda_heir.GetKingQueen] or take the opportunity to declare independence. Only time will tell if the new [bretwalda_heir.GetKingQueen] [bretwalda_heir.GetFirstName] will be able to live up to the feats and expectations of [bretwalda_heir.GetHerHis] predecessor, or if it will be up to another king to take up the mantle as lord over the Anglo-Saxons.
In time, I too will be Bretwalda...
Who will unite the Anglo-Saxons now?
Excellent.
This is interesting news...
Fall of the Bretwalda

The reign of Bretwalda [FromFromFrom.GetFirstName] has ended, and with it [FromFromFrom.GetHerHis] hegenomy over the other Anglo-Saxon kingdoms. Already many of the other kings have taken the opportunity to break away from [FromFromFrom.GetHerHis] hegemony, claiming that their oaths were personally to Bretwalda [FromFromFrom.GetFirstName] and [FromFromFrom.GetHerHim] alone.\n\nOnly time will tell if another king will be able to rise up above the fray to unite the fractious Anglo-Saxon kingdoms and reclaim the title of Bretwalda once more.
[FromFromFrom.GetSheHe] did not deserve the honour anyways.
Their treachery shall not be forgotten...
Who will unite the Anglo-Saxons now?
Yes, let them fight among themselves...
This is interesting news...

The reign of Bretwalda [FromFromFromFrom.GetFirstName] has ended, and with it [FromFromFromFrom.GetHerHis] hegenomy over the other Anglo-Saxon kingdoms. Already many of the other kings have taken the opportunity to break away from [FromFromFromFrom.GetHerHis] hegemony, claiming that their oaths were personally to Bretwalda [FromFromFromFrom.GetFirstName] and [FromFromFromFrom.GetHerHim] alone.\n\nOnly time will tell if another king will be able to rise up above the fray to unite the fractious Anglo-Saxon kingdoms and reclaim the title of Bretwalda once more.
Their treachery shall not be forgotten...
Cynerice of Ænglaland

With the loss of territory and control over [Root.GetHerHis] subject kings, the authority of the Bretwalda of Ænglaland has collapsed to the point where [Root.GetSheHe] cannot be seriously considered to hold imperium over the Kings of the Anglo-Saxons.\n\nWithout the support of his subjects and vassals, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has been declared unfit for the prestigious title, and from this moment on will no longer be recognized as Bretwalda.
This is unacceptable!
No lesser ruler can be Bretwalda!
This is interesting news...

Only the greatest and most powerful Anglo-Saxon kings who have asserted their dominance over the kingdoms of the Anglo-Saxons can claim the title of §YBretwalda of Ænglaland§!. This title can only be created by taking the §YClaim the Cynerice of Ænglaland§! decision, available to any independent Anglo-Saxon king in Britannia.
The House of West Seaxe

After gaining independence from the neighbouring Anglo-Saxon realms, [Root.GetTitledName] has proclaimed the foundation of the 'House of West Seaxe'. This noble house shall be recognized as distinct from any other ruling dynasty, and [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.GetPossPronoun] offspring will no longer refer to former relatives as kin.
Glory to the House of West Seaxe!
This is interesting news...
The House of Mercia

After gaining independence from the neighbouring Anglo-Saxon realms, [Root.GetTitledName] has proclaimed the foundation of the 'House of Mercia'. This noble house shall be recognized as distinct from any other ruling dynasty, and [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.GetPossPronoun] offspring will no longer refer to former relatives as kin.
Glory to the House of Mercia!
This is interesting news...

After gaining independence from the neighbouring Anglo-Saxon realms, [Root.GetTitledName] has proclaimed the foundation of the 'House of East Seaxe'. This noble house shall be recognized as distinct from any other ruling dynasty, and [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.GetPossPronoun] offspring will no longer refer to former relatives as kin.
Glory to the House of East Seaxe!

Great [Root.GetTitledFirstName]! I and a powerful group of loyalists have revolted against the usurper, [From.Holder.TopLiege.GetTitledName], demanding the return of [From.Kingdom.GetAdjective] rule over your rightful lands. Wish us luck!

Signed,
[revolt_leader.GetTitledName]
Integration of [From.GetBaseName]

With the support of the local nobility and religious authorities, you have issued an official declaration proclaiming the incorporation of [From.GetBaseName] as an integral part of the kingdom. From this day on, the [From.GetFullBaseName] will be considered a de jure part of the [From.Kingdom.GetFullBaseName].

With the support of the local nobility and religious authorities, [Root.GetTitledName] has issued an official declaration proclaiming the incorporation of [From.GetBaseName] as an integral part of the kingdom. From this day on, the [From.GetFullBaseName] will be considered a de jure part of the [From.Kingdom.GetFullBaseName].
Excellent.
This is unacceptable!
This is interesting news...
